headline: OpenAI‚Äôs Unprecedented $30 Billion Oracle Deal Reshapes AI Data Centers
summary: BitcoinWorld OpenAI‚Äôs Unprecedented $30 Billion Oracle Deal Reshapes AI Data Centers In the rapidly evolving landscape where artificial intelligence and decentralized technologies often intersect, a recent colossal agreement has sent ripples across the tech world, hinting at the immense infrastructure demands of the AI era. The spotlight is firmly on the OpenAI Oracle deal , a staggering $30 billion annual commitment that underscores the insatiable hunger for computational power. For those tracking the convergence of cutting-edge tech and its foundational needs, this development offers crucial insights into the future demands on energy, capital, and innovation, areas that often resonate with the high-stakes world of cryptocurrency mining and blockchain infrastructure. The Unveiling of an AI Colossus: OpenAI‚Äôs Landmark Oracle Deal Last month, the tech world buzzed with speculation following Oracle‚Äôs cryptic SEC filing, revealing a massive cloud deal poised to generate an unprecedented $30 billion annually. The identity of the mystery client remained under wraps, fueling intense curiosity across Silicon Valley and beyond. Now, the veil has been lifted, confirming that the client is none other than OpenAI, the pioneering force behind ChatGPT. Sam Altman , OpenAI‚Äôs CEO, personally confirmed the details (though not the exact dollar amount) via an X post and a company blog, solidifying what many suspected. This monumental OpenAI Oracle deal immediately propelled Oracle‚Äôs stock to an all-time high, cementing founder Larry Ellison‚Äôs status as the world‚Äôs second-richest person, according to Bloomberg. The sheer scale of this agreement is mind-boggling; for context, Oracle‚Äôs entire cloud services revenue for its fiscal year 2025 across all customers combined was a mere $24.5 billion. This single deal with OpenAI dwarfs that figure, signaling a seismic shift in the demand for specialized data center infrastructure. Powering the Future: The Stargate Project and AI Data Centers So, what exactly necessitates such an astronomical investment? The answer lies in the ambitious Stargate Project , a colossal data center initiative announced by OpenAI, Oracle, and Softbank in January. This $500 billion endeavor aims to build a new generation of AI infrastructure. The $30 billion annual commitment from OpenAI to Oracle specifically covers 4.5 gigawatts of capacity for Stargate I, the project‚Äôs initial site located in Abilene, Texas. To put 4.5 gigawatts into perspective, The Wall Street Journal reports it‚Äôs equivalent to the power output of two Hoover Dams, enough electricity to supply approximately four million homes. This highlights the incredible energy demands of advanced AI models and the sheer scale required to train and operate them. Building these next-generation AI data centers is not merely a financial transaction; it‚Äôs a monumental engineering and logistical challenge. It requires immense capital expenditure, securing vast tracts of land, and ensuring a stable, massive power supply. While the promise of Stargate is immense, the journey to its realization is fraught with significant costs and complexities for both OpenAI and Oracle. Oracle‚Äôs Strategic Investment in AI Infrastructure For Oracle, this deal represents a massive strategic pivot and a bold bet on the future of artificial intelligence. While the $30 billion annual revenue stream is certainly a boon, it comes with a hefty price tag in terms of upfront investment. Oracle‚Äôs CEO, Safra Catz, reported that the company spent $21.2 billion on capital expenditures in its last fiscal year, with an additional $25 billion projected for the current year. This nearly $50 billion over two years is largely directed towards expanding its global footprint of AI data centers and bolstering its cloud capabilities. It‚Äôs crucial to note that while OpenAI‚Äôs demands are significant, these investments also support Oracle‚Äôs existing and growing customer base for its Oracle Cloud Services . This aggressive spending underscores Oracle‚Äôs commitment to becoming a dominant player in the AI infrastructure market, competing directly with hyperscalers like AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud. The race to provide the underlying computational backbone for the AI revolution is intense, and Oracle is clearly making a powerful statement with its investment strategy and this landmark deal. Sam Altman‚Äôs Vision: Scaling AI and Financial Implications The financial implications of this deal for OpenAI are profound. Just last month, Sam Altman revealed that OpenAI had reached an impressive $10 billion in annual recurring revenue (ARR), a significant leap from $5.5 billion the previous year. However, this single commitment to Oracle‚Äîa staggering $30 billion per year‚Äîis already triple OpenAI‚Äôs current annual revenue. This raises important questions about the company‚Äôs long-term financial strategy and how it plans to fund such colossal infrastructure projects while also covering its operational expenses, research and development, and existing data center commitments. It suggests a future where the cost of developing and deploying advanced AI models will require unprecedented levels of capital, potentially necessitating further massive funding rounds or a significant increase in commercialization efforts. Altman‚Äôs bold moves, including this partnership, signal a clear intent to scale OpenAI‚Äôs capabilities to a level previously unimaginable, pushing the boundaries of what AI can achieve, even if it means navigating immense financial challenges. Industry Insights and Future Prospects The OpenAI Oracle deal is more than just a business transaction; it‚Äôs a powerful indicator of the direction the entire tech industry is heading. The demand for specialized AI data centers and high-performance computing is skyrocketing, driven by the rapid advancements in large language models and other AI applications. This arms race for AI dominance will likely see more such massive collaborations and investments, as companies vie for the necessary infrastructure to train and deploy ever more complex models. Events like the 20th anniversary of Bitcoin World Disrupt, featuring heavyweights from Netflix, ElevenLabs, Wayve, and Sequoia Capital, offer a glimpse into the broader ecosystem of innovation and investment that fuels startup growth and sharpens industry insights. These gatherings provide invaluable opportunities to learn from top voices in tech, understanding the interplay between venture capital, groundbreaking technologies, and the foundational infrastructure like Oracle Cloud Services that make it all possible. The future of AI hinges on the ability to scale computational power, and this deal is a testament to that undeniable truth. In essence, the revelation of OpenAI as the recipient of Oracle‚Äôs $30 billion annual cloud deal is a landmark moment, not just for the companies involved, but for the entire technological landscape. It vividly illustrates the monumental scale and cost associated with building the next generation of artificial intelligence. The Stargate Project , powered by this unprecedented investment in AI data centers , signifies a future where computational capacity will be measured in gigawatts, and the strategic partnerships between AI innovators and infrastructure giants like Oracle will define the pace of progress. While the financial commitment from OpenAI is substantial relative to its current revenue, it underscores Sam Altman‚Äôs unwavering vision for a future where AI capabilities are boundless. This deal reshapes expectations for AI infrastructure, setting a new benchmark for investment and collaboration in the pursuit of advanced intelligence. To learn more about the latest AI infrastructure trends, explore our article on key developments shaping AI models and their institutional adoption. This post OpenAI‚Äôs Unprecedented $30 Billion Oracle Deal Reshapes AI Data Centers first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

headline: JUST IN: Popular Cryptocurrency Platform May Launch Its Own Altcoin, Sources Say
summary: Cryptocurrency-based prediction platform Polymarket is considering the option of issuing its own stablecoin. According to a source familiar with the matter, the company plans to either generate reserve revenues itself by issuing this new stablecoin or enter into a revenue-sharing agreement with Circle on the amount of USDC held on the platform. Polymarket, which recently reached a $1 billion valuation, wants to control the returns from reserves of USDC, Circle's dollar-pegged token, which is heavily used in betting pools. A Polymarket representative stated that no final decision has yet been made on the stablecoin. The passage of stablecoin laws in the US last week has increased interest in the field, making stablecoin issuance a more attractive business model for both crypto firms and traditional financial players. These developments are encouraging new companies to enter the market, inspired by the success of stablecoin giants like Tether and Circle. Related News: Bitcoin Surges, Reaches Above $120,000 Again - Here Are the Latest Data and What We Know But launching a stablecoin is a complex process from technical and regulatory perspectives, and Circle is entering into revenue-sharing agreements with exchanges, payments companies, and fintech firms to maintain its advantage in this competitive landscape. For Polymarket, the regulatory aspect is relatively straightforward. According to the source, ‚ÄúPolymarket locks up a large amount of stablecoins in prediction pools and seeks a way to generate returns from these reserves. Because their ecosystem is closed, they can only convert USDC or USDT into their proprietary stablecoins. This is a technically simple, secure, and controllable structure.‚Äù While the amount of USDC held on the platform varies depending on the volume of bets, estimates of approximately $8 billion were made during last year's US election cycle. In May, Polymarket received 15.9 million visits, according to SimilarWeb data. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: JUST IN: Popular Cryptocurrency Platform May Launch Its Own Altcoin, Sources Say

headline: JPMorgan Mulls Using Customer Crypto as Loan Collateral: Report
summary: JPMorgan is reportedly looking at offering loans backed by customer-held crypto assets, such as Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH). If implemented, it would mark a major shift for CEO Jamie Dimon, who once called Bitcoin a ‚Äúfraud‚Äù and predicted it would collapse. Crypto-Backed Loans Could Start Next Year The Financial Times revealed that the bank could launch the initiative next year. However, sources quoted by the publication emphasized that the plans could still change. The firm‚Äôs top executive was once a vocal critic of Bitcoin, saying the excitement around it would ‚Äúeventually blow up,‚Äù and claiming it was only used by ‚Äúmurderers and drug dealers.‚Äù He is also reported to have said he would fire any trader who dealt with it. According to the FT report, Dimon‚Äôs statements pushed away some potential clients, particularly those who had made their money through crypto or strongly believed in its long-term value. However, he has taken a more neutral stance recently: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think you should smoke, but I defend your right to smoke. I defend your right to buy Bitcoin. Go at it,‚Äù he said in May. The bank reportedly plans to begin lending against crypto exchange-traded funds (ETFs) holdings, with the use of the actual digital assets as collateral seen as the next natural step. Meanwhile, competitors like Morgan Stanley are also joining the crypto bandwagon, with the bank also considering offering digital asset trading through its E-Trade platform. However, a few holdouts remain, with Goldman Sachs one of the more prominent financial institutions yet to succumb to market sentiment. According to the Financial Times, a key concern for banks is that digital assets may facilitate criminal activity, raising questions around compliance and money laundering. To issue loans directly secured by crypto, JPMorgan would also need to address the technical challenges of managing assets seized from clients who default on their loans. Shifting Landscape Earlier this year, Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan shared his thoughts on the future of crypto in the traditional financial space. In an interview, he stressed that the industry is ready to embrace it for transactions, but only if the regulatory landscape is well-defined. Things have certainly been going in the direction he hoped for as regulatory sentiment in Washington shifts under the Trump administration. Last week, the U.S. House of Representatives passed a bill to regulate stablecoins, marking the first significant piece of crypto legislation approved by Congress. Furthermore, in April, the Federal Reserve Board lifted restrictions on crypto-related activities for banks. This change means they are no longer obligated to seek prior approval for their digital asset and stablecoin operations. The post JPMorgan Mulls Using Customer Crypto as Loan Collateral: Report appeared first on CryptoPotato .

headline: SEC Chair Paul Atkins Drops Bullish Bitcoin And Crypto Bombshell
summary: The U.S. SEC Chair, Paul Atkins , recently discussed Bitcoin and crypto in general while making some bullish statements for the industry. He again affirmed his commitment to providing a regulatory-friendly environment for the industry. Paul Atkins Talks Bullish on Bitcoin and Other Cryptos In a CNBC interview , Paul Atkins remarked that Trump‚Äôs signing of the GENIUS Act into law was a great watershed for the crypto industry. He added that for the first time, the U.S. Government has also given its stamp of approval for stablecoins. He described these types of digital assets as ones that will be very important for the market, as they help lower costs and mitigate market risk. The SEC Chair noted that the GENIUS Act and stablecoins don‚Äôt exactly concern the Commission, unlike the way they have focused on Bitcoin and other cryptos. However, affirmed that his agency is committed to enabling the smooth implementation of this crypto legislation. Atkins had also previously stated that they would consider additional steps that might help assist SEC registrants using payment stablecoins, including for settlement and margining. Furthermore, during the interview, the SEC Chair dropped a bombshell when he confirmed that Ethereum is not a security, just like Bitcoin. He added that the Ethereum blockchain is a key component for a lot of other digital assets, suggesting that tokens are also not necessarily securities. Akins made this comment while answering a question on companies that were looking to emulate Michael Saylor‚Äôs Strategy by buying Bitcoin while some are pivoting to Ethereum. He remarked that he is not in a position to tell these companies what assets to buy or not. However, the SEC Chair acknowledged that it is encouraging to see these digital assets being embraced by the markets. He added that this will provide a good foundation for future development and innovation in the sector. GENIUS Act Will Benefit Ethereum The Most Ether Machine Chairman Andrew Keys was also on CNBC to discuss the passing of the GENIUS Act. He declared that Ethereum is the largest beneficiary of the crypto legislation. He explained that the majority of stablecoins are issued on the network, meaning that Ethereum is likely to witness greater adoption following the signing of the GENIUS Act. Keys further remarked that Ethereum is experiencing power-law dynamics, whereby ‚Äú90% of tokenized assets and stablecoins‚Äù are deployed on the network. It is worth noting that Ether Machine has opted to become an Ethereum treasury company rather than one that holds Bitcoin like Strategy. The company will list on the Nasdaq through a merger and is expected to raise over $1.6 million. The company aims to launch with 400,000 ETH on its balance sheet, competing with companies like SharpLink Gaming .

headline: Accumulation of Major Bitcoin Investors and Whales Powering BTC Uptrend As Ethereum Witnesses Trend Reversal in Buyer Behavior: Glassnode
summary: Analytics firm Glassnode says that large Bitcoin investors are gobbling up BTC , fueling the crypto king‚Äôs ascent above $100,000. In a post on the social media platform X, Glassnode says that all major Bitcoin cohorts by wallet size are now back in ‚Äúnear-perfect‚Äù accumulation mode. The analytics firm released a Trend Accumulation Score chart by cohort, revealing that wallets holding less than one BTC to those with over 10,000 BTC show scores of 1 or near 1, signaling strong accumulation across all investor segments. ‚ÄúEven >10,000 BTC whales are participating at levels last seen in Dec 2024. The alignment across wallet sizes suggests broad-based conviction behind the current BTC uptrend.‚Äù Source: Glassnode/X At time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at $117,412. Turning to Ethereum, Glassnode notes a renewed influx of first-time ETH investors following a prolonged period of declining interest from the group. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre seeing the first signs of a trend reversal in ETH buyer behavior. Since early July, the supply held by first-time buyers has increased by ~16%, suggesting renewed interest and inflows from fresh market participants.‚Äù Source: Glassnode/X At time of writing, Ethereum is worth $3,765. As for the layer-1 protocol Solana, Glassnode says that SOL may be poised for a huge upside burst after taking out a key resistance area. ‚ÄúThe next major resistance for SOL may sit around $190, where investors have accumulated over 8 million SOL. Above this level, supply becomes less dense ‚Äì suggesting that, if demand persists, the uptrend could accelerate due to reduced overhead resistance.‚Äù Source: Glassnode/X At time of writing, SOL is trading at $197, well above Glassnode‚Äôs resistance point. headline: Bitcoin Final Push? Wave (5) Could Deliver A Spectacular Breakout
summary: Bitcoin is turning heads once again as it climbs steadily within a rising channel, teasing a potential explosive move. According to chart watchers, the current rally aligns with Wave (5) of an Elliott Wave structure, historically the phase that unleashes the most aggressive price action. With momentum building and institutional demand ramping up, could this be the final leg before Bitcoin launches toward uncharted territory? Rising Channel Holds Firm As Wave (5) Builds Steam In a recent update, market analyst LSplayQ pointed out that Bitcoin is steadily climbing within a clearly defined rising channel, with the price now trading close to $118,000. This structured upward movement signals strong market confidence, with buyers consistently stepping in at higher levels to support the trend. Related Reading: Hold On For Dear Life: This Bullish Bitcoin Metric Just Touched A 15-Year High The analysis ties this momentum to an unfolding Elliott Wave formation, where Wave (5) is currently in play. The previous waves have displayed a clean pattern of higher highs and higher lows‚Äîa signature of impulsive bullish behavior. This suggests that Bitcoin‚Äôs price action is not random but follows a predictable rhythm often seen during strong uptrends. With Wave (5) potentially in progress, LSplayQ believes that Bitcoin could soon challenge the upper boundary of its rising channel. If this plays out as expected, the next target zone could be around the $140,000 region, a level that aligns with the broader technical projection of this ongoing wave structure. A breakout above the rising channel could spark even more aggressive upside, while any signs of weakness near these resistance levels might indicate a short-term pullback. However, the bullish setup remains intact for now as Wave (5) continues to unfold with precision. Institutional Buys Push Forward, But Technicals Urge Patience With institutions like Strategy continuing to accumulate, LSplayQ suggests that Bitcoin still has room to push higher. The growing interest from large-scale investors adds weight to the ongoing bullish momentum, further fueling optimism for an extended rally. Related Reading: Bitcoin Price Eyes $123K Explosion‚ÄîTraders Brace for Breakout However, there are signs that the market may be nearing a temporary exhaustion point. The Relative Strength Index (RSI) is edging toward overbought territory, hinting at a potential cooling-off period. This doesn‚Äôt necessarily signal the end of the trend but could open the door for a short-term correction. Should a pullback occur, traders will likely shift their focus to key support zones. According to LSplayQ, the $99,531 level stands out as a critical area where buyers may step in to defend the uptrend. Holding above that threshold could set the stage for the next leg upward once the consolidation phase concludes. Featured image from Pixabay, chart from Tradingview.com

headline: The Node: JPM‚Äôs BTC Lending Play
summary: The Financial Times reports that JPMorgan, the world‚Äôs biggest bank, is looking into issuing crypto-backed loans, meaning that its clients may soon be able to pledge bitcoin, ether, or some other token to borrow dollars. The news is notable for a couple of reasons. Crypto folks love pointing out that Jamie Dimon, the bank‚Äôs chief executive, famously said in 2017 that he‚Äôd fire any employee caught trading bitcoin for being ‚Äústupid,‚Äù so JPMorgan considering the issuance of such a product (and getting involved with stablecoins ) is seen as vindication by some in the industry. This is an excerpt from The Node newsletter, a daily roundup of the most pivotal crypto news on CoinDesk and beyond. You can subscribe to get the full newsletter here . More interesting is what JPMorgan‚Äôs move could end up meaning for crypto lending. The Bank of Dimon isn‚Äôt the first TradFi firm to look into crypto-backed loans (Cantor Fitzgerald announced a similar program last July) but it‚Äôs certainly the largest. At the end of 2024, the crypto lending market stood at $36.5 billion, down 43% from its $64.4 billion peak at the height of the 2021 bull run. The lending sector was dominated by Tether, followed by Galaxy Digital and Ledn. Together, the three firms accounted for 90% of $11.2 billion outstanding loans (excluding DeFi, which saw $19.1 billion in borrowings across 20 applications and 12 blockchains). I‚Äôm sure these numbers need updating, considering how many crypto native firms have announced their entry into the market since then ‚Äî Coinbase , Strike , Xapo Bank , Lava , Onramp and Arch , and even real-estate focused Propy , to name a few. The growth of the sector is great for consumers because it will force interest rates on crypto-backed loans to drop significantly, Mauricio Di Bartolomeo, co-founder of bitcoin lender Ledn, told CoinDesk in an interview back in April. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a seller‚Äôs market right now,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe are lending out dollars fully collateralized at north of 12.5%, with zero losses over seven years. Banks are going to look at this and say ‚ÄòWow, this is a great rate of return.‚Äô One bank will come in with 12% interest. Another will do 10%. Another says 9%. So this is going to compress, and compress.‚Äù Down the line, such loans could become competitive with home equity or personal lines of credit , Di Bartolomeo said. Even better, rates wouldn‚Äôt simply drop in Western countries with efficient banking systems, but all over the globe. ‚ÄúGold in a vault in Switzerland is not gold in a vault in Venezuela, but bitcoin in Colombia is bitcoin in Madrid is bitcoin anywhere in the world. As an underwriter, I have uniform collateral,‚Äù Di Bartolomeo said. JPMorgan‚Äôs foray into the sector takes us one step closer towards fulfilling that vision.

headline: Solana SSK ETF breaks $100M as Wall Street warms to crypto staking
summary: SSK, the first US ETF to combine spot Solana exposure with on-chain staking rewards, attracted over $100M in 12 trading days.
